TopicTitle: The shared .23 release features news thread.

Articles.Content: Would be awesome if we could switch between preset thrust limits with action groups...
From Yarg's video, it seems like the ISP for the RAPIER is around 160. Also, apparently the ISP increases the deeper in the atmosphere you go?

SABRE engines: http://i.imgur.com/zzdMBmX.jpg

SABRE in action: http://i.imgur.com/VlUkI9a.jpg

it seems like the ISP for the RAPIER is around 160.

apparently the ISP increases the deeper in the atmosphere you go?

SABRE engines: http://i.imgur.com/zzdMBmX.jpg

SABRE in action: http://i.imgur.com/VlUkI9a.jpg

Airhoggy, much?

Something big mentioned earlier was the optimizations. Slightly apples to oranges, but a mention of a player running 20 fps with a 400 part ship, going to 40 fps with a 700 part ship.

Space Stations for the win!

SABRE engines: http://i.imgur.com/zzdMBmX.jpg

SABRE in action: http://i.imgur.com/VlUkI9a.jpg

While this is good to see. The only bad part is. At least by the looks of it is we will still need to spam air intakes.
No mk2/3 cockpit interiors.

While this is good to see. The only bad part is. At least by the looks of it is we will still need to spam air intakes.

Don't want to make SSTOs too easy! Part of the fun of designing them is managing the tradeoffs involved in ceiling of jet operations.
Looks like this update will be big.

Nice if we can set acceleration limits. Set to 0g to hover.

maintain velocity*

srsly...
The Sabres look like punctured reaction wheels. I can see that tweakables will make a big difference.

Would be nice if you could lock the acceleration so you could maintain a constant speed as you burn off fuel or even drop spent tanks, but from what I gather it's thrust that can be limited to a maximum below the engine's rated max thrust. Still useful, of course, but it doesn't sound like we're getting flight computers quite that advanced in this update.

Maybe in 0.24...
Will we be able to limit or disable engine gimbal before flying?

Will we be able to limit or disable engine gimbal before flying?

Yes, looks like you can

Will we be able to limit or disable engine gimbal before flying?

http://i.imgur.com/0gp9PqF.jpg

Tweakables in VAB:

http://i.imgur.com/95yAppx.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/2Srmhxw.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/V02RH7h.jpg

It looks like every engine has thrust limiter. Great news for shuttles

Looks like this update will be big.

I'm not sure I'd say it'll be "Big" as far as the number of features. In the intro, HarvesteR said a lot of the work on this update was concentrated on addressing bugs and performance.

http://i.imgur.com/0gp9PqF.jpg

Tweakables in VAB:

http://i.imgur.com/95yAppx.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/2Srmhxw.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/V02RH7h.jpg

It looks like every engine has thrust limiter. Great news for shuttles

Oh man, they tightened up the GUI too, looks great!
Just realised, think of it: Shuttle. Reduce thrust on specific engine. Balencing.

I'm not sure I'd say it'll be "Big" as far as the number of features. In the intro, HarvesteR said a lot of the work on this update was concentrated on addressing bugs and performance.
Well, the update will bring some features which are important. Bug fixes are necessary.
I'd prefer the old GUI

I would say "big" in that in changes a lot of fundamental aspects of how rockets are build and flown. Mostly that's through tweakables, but the new engine and performance improvements could make a really big difference.

It sounds like there are lots of changes to career mode too, but I think the next really big step there will be some kind of economy system.

R.A.P.I.E.R.s confirmed for OP engines.

I liked some of the options for the tweakables part. I have my doubts about it, things I'd like to see (if they even are implemented) that they haven't showed yet. I still think this was for a 40 day update at most, not 65.
Any info on rapier's weight?
Have they shown anything new yet?
